title: Ten-Year BTP-Bund Spread Seen at Attractive Level in 2H

title: Sanofi Upgrades Outlook After Earnings Beat
description: Sanofi raised its 2023 EPS guidance after it reported second-quarter adjusted earnings that beat analysts’ expectations and despite sales falling short of estimates.

title: AstraZeneca Core EPS Rises 25%; Maintains Revenue Outlook
description: AstraZeneca said its second-quarter core earnings per share rose to $2.15, and reiterated its 2023 forceast for revenue to increase by a low-to-mid single-digit percentage.

title: Casino Strikes Debt Deal With Kretinsky-Led Consortium
description: Casino has reached an agreement in principle with a consortium led by Daniel Kretinsky to shore up its capital base and restructure its debt, but will see shareholder value “massively diluted.”

title: NatWest Second Quarter Tops Hopes But Trims Guidance
description: NatWest posted an operating pretax profit of £1.8 billion for the second quarter and announced a £500 million share buyback, but lowered its net interest margin guidance for 2023.

title: Hermes Earnings Jump on Strong Asia Growth
description: Hermes said recurring operating income grew 28% in the first half to almost €3 billion, helped by the rebound of wholesale and in-store sales in Asia, and the company backed its medium-term goal for revenue growth at constant exchange rates.

title: IAG Profit Beats Forecasts, Sees Strong Outlook
description: IAG reported a sharply-higher adjusted operating profit of €1.3 billion and said its outlook for summer was encouraging, with around 80% of its expected revenue already booked, while full-year capacity was seen around 97% of pre-Covid-19 levels.

title: Eni Outlook on Track Despite Profit Slide
description: Eni said its adjusted operating profit fell to €3.4 billion in the second quarter on sales that dropped 38%, as weaker market prices took their toll, but the company maintained its full-year production and profit targets while trimming its outlook for cashflow.

title: OMV Profits Hit by Lower Prices
description: OMV posted a 67% drop in adjusted net profit in the second quarter after market prices fell from record-high levels, and for the year, it forecast an average Brent price of $75-$80 and an average realized gas price of around EUR30.

title: Clariant Keeps Outlook After Weaker Secoind Quarter
description: Clariant reported weaker second-quarter earnings of CHF175 million and warned that it didn’t expect a substantial economic recovery in the second half, confirming its recently-updated sales and Ebitda targets for 2023.

title: Air France-KLM Tops Forecasts, Sees Strong Demand
description: Air France-KLM confirmed its capacity forecast for the year after it reported second-quarter results well ahead of analysts’ expectations, with operating profit rising 90% to €733 million.

title: Vinci Posts Higher Profit, Strong Order Growth
description: Vinci reported a higher net profit of €2.1 billion in the first half on a 14% rise in sales and said it had positive cash flow and an order book of €61.5 billion.

title: Capgemini Maintains Outlook as Profits Rise 8%
description: Capgemini posted an operating profit of €1.2 billion in the first half and confirmed its full-year growth targets but acknowledged that the more challenging macro-economic environment led to a slowdown in line with its expectations.

title: China's Housing Ministry Urges More Property Rescue Efforts
description: China’s housing minister Ni Hong has sought cuts on home mortgage rates and down-payment ratios for first-time home buyers, among other measures, that Beijing hopes will help ease a protracted property slump amid sluggish economic growth.

title: Standard Chartered Lifts Guidance on Strong First-Half Earnings
description: Standard Chartered raised its full-year income guidance after its first-half net profit rose 20% on year, helped by higher net interest income.

description: Pyongyang held large military parade, with first foreign delegations allowed in the country since the pandemic.
